summary: The Fentanyl Kills Act amends Title 18 of the United States Code, focusing on fentanyl-related offenses. It defines "trafficked fentanyl" broadly to include various activities involving the production, distribution, and financing of fentanyl and related substances. The bill stipulates that individuals involved in fentanyl trafficking are deemed to have attempted murder and are subject to corresponding penalties. This includes activity both inside and outside the U.S. if the intent is to distribute within the country.
